ğŸ“¦ Installation

Multiple ways to get BLite into your .NET project.

NuGet Package (Recommended)

Install the all-in-one package using the .NET CLI:

dotnet add package BLite

Or using Package Manager Console in Visual Studio:

Install-Package BLite

Or add directly to your .csproj:

<ItemGroup>
  <PackageReference Include="BLite" Version="1.6.1" />
</ItemGroup>

What's Included

The BLite metapackage installs all necessary components:

  • BLite.Core - Storage engine, transactions, indexing
  • BLite.Bson - Zero-allocation BSON serializer
  • BLite.SourceGenerators - Compile-time code generation
âœ¨ Automatic Setup: Source generators are automatically activated when you add the package. No additional configuration needed!

Build from Source

Clone the repository and build locally:

git clone https://github.com/EntglDb/BLite.git
cd BLite
dotnet build -c Release

Then reference the projects directly in your solution:

<ItemGroup>
  <ProjectReference Include="..\BLite\src\BLite.Core\BLite.Core.csproj" />
  <ProjectReference Include="..\BLite\src\BLite.Bson\BLite.Bson.csproj" />
</ItemGroup>

Requirements

  • .NET 10 SDK or later
  • Windows, Linux, or macOS
  • C# 13 language features
âš ï¸ Note: BLite currently targets .NET 10 to leverage modern performance features like Span<T> optimizations. Support for .NET Standard 2.1 is under consideration.

Next Steps
